title: Market capitalization of leading 100 banks worldwide 2016 to 2019
summary: This bar chart has 15 columns on the x axis representing Quarter, and Market capitalization in trillion Euros in each Quarter on the y axis.
The Market capitalization in trillion Euros is highest at Quarter Q4 '17 and lowest at Quarter Q2 '16.
The highest Quarter Q4 '17 has 1.5 more Market capitalization in trillion Euros than the lowest Quarter Q2 '16.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Quarter in the x axis and Market capitalization in trillion Euros in the y axis.
Quarter Q4 '17 has the highest Market capitalization in trillion Euros and Q2 '16 has the lowest Market capitalization in trillion Euros.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Quarter in the x axis and Market capitalization in trillion Euros in the y axis.
The maximum Market capitalization in trillion Euros 5.6 is found at Quarter Q4 '17 and the minimum is found at Q2 '16 where Quarter is 4.1.
The second highest Market capitalization in trillion Euros is appeared to be the Quarter Q1 '17.
The minimum Quarter Q2 '16 has got 1.37 times less Market capitalization in trillion Euros than the maximum Quarter Q4 '17.
The Quarter Q4 '17 has the highest Market capitalization in trillion Euros, followed by Q1 '17, and Q1 '17. Down to the Quarter Q2 '16 which is the lowest.
The Market capitalization in trillion Euros has reduced over the past 15 Quarters.
Quarter Q2 '19, Q1 '19, Q2 '18, and Q4 '16 have the same Market capitalization in trillion Euros.
The Quarter Q4 '17 has 1.11 times more Market capitalization in trillion Euros than average.
Summing up the values of all Quarters, we get total 76.0.
